title: Determines parentage of a child for purposes of applying to the supreme court or family court for a writ of habeas corpus
summary: Determines parentage of a child for purposes of applying to the supreme court or family court for a writ of habeas corpus; defines parent.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          700

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. PAULIN, GOTTFRIED, HEVESI, GALEF, PHEFFER, KELL-
         NER, JAFFEE, MILLMAN, TITONE -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. GABRYS-
         ZAK, JEFFRIES, MAISEL, SCHIMEL, SWEENEY, WEISENBERG,  WRIGHT  --  read
         once and referred to the Committee on Judiciary

       AN  ACT  to amend the domestic relations law, in relation to determining
         parentage of a child for purposes of applying to the supreme court  or
         family court for a writ of habeas corpus

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 70 of the domestic relations  law,  as  amended  by
    2  chapter 457 of the laws of 1988, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S  70.  Habeas  corpus for child detained by parent. (a) Where a minor
    4  child is residing within this state, either  parent  may  apply  to  the
    5  supreme  court  OR FAMILY COURT for a writ of habeas corpus to have such
    6  minor child brought before such court; and on the  return  thereof,  the
    7  court,  on due consideration, may award the natural guardianship, charge
    8  and custody of such child to either parent for  such  time,  under  such
    9  regulations  and  restrictions, and with such provisions and directions,
   10  as the case may require, and may at any time thereafter vacate or modify
   11  such order. In all cases there shall be no  prima  facie  right  to  the
   12  custody  of  the  child  in either parent, but the court shall determine
   13  solely what is for the best interest of the child, and  what  will  best
   14  promote  [its]  HIS OR HER welfare and happiness, and make award accord-
   15  ingly.
   16    (b) Any order under this section which applies to rights of visitation
   17  with a child remanded or placed in the care of a person, official, agen-
   18  cy or institution pursuant to article ten of the  family  court  act  or
   19  pursuant  to  an  instrument approved under section three hundred fifty-
   20  eight-a of the social services law, shall be enforceable pursuant to the
   21  provisions of part eight of article ten  of  such  act,  sections  three

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00986-03-1

       A. 700                              2

    1  hundred  fifty-eight-a  and  three  hundred  eighty-four-a of the social
    2  services law and other applicable provisions of law against  any  person
    3  or  official  having care and custody, or temporary care and custody, of
    4  such child.
    5    (C)  FOR  PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, THE TERM PARENT SHALL INCLUDE: (I)
    6  AN INDIVIDUAL WHO IS THE BIRTH OR GENETIC PARENT OF  SUCH  MINOR  CHILD,
    7  (II)  AN  INDIVIDUAL  WHO HAS LEGALLY ADOPTED SUCH MINOR CHILD, (III) AN
    8  INDIVIDUAL WHO IS ADJUDICATED TO BE THE PARENT OF SUCH MINOR CHILD, (IV)
    9  AN INDIVIDUAL WHO IS A PARENT OF  SUCH  MINOR  CHILD  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   10  SECTION OR OTHER LEGAL PRESUMPTION, (V) AN INDIVIDUAL WHO IS A PARENT OF
   11  SUCH MINOR CHILD PURSUANT TO AN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF PARENTAGE, OR (VI) AN
   12  INDIVIDUAL  WHO  IS A PARENT OF SUCH MINOR CHILD PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION
   13  (D) OR (E) OF THIS SECTION.
   14    (D) FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, A PARENT SHALL INCLUDE A PERSON  WHO
   15  MUTUALLY  CONSENTS  WITH  A  WOMAN TO BE A PARENT OF HER CHILD CONCEIVED
   16  USING DONOR SPERM, PROVIDED THAT SUCH AGREEMENT IS NOT IN  CONTRAVENTION
   17  OF ARTICLE EIGHT OF THIS CHAPTER REGARDING SURROGATE PARENTING.
   18    (I)  CONSENT  BY  A WOMAN AND A PERSON WHO INTENDS TO BE A PARENT OF A
   19  CHILD BORN TO THE WOMAN USING DONOR SPERM SHALL BE IN WRITING SIGNED  BY
   20  THE  WOMAN  AND  THE  INTENDED  PARENT  BEFORE OR AFTER THE BIRTH OF THE
   21  CHILD.
   22    (II) FAILURE OF AN INDIVIDUAL TO SIGN A CONSENT AS PROVIDED  IN  PARA-
   23  GRAPH  (I) OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL NOT PRECLUDE A FINDING OF THE INDI-
   24  VIDUAL'S PARENTAGE OF THE CHILD IF THE WOMAN AND THE INDIVIDUAL  RESIDED
   25  TOGETHER  IN THE SAME HOUSEHOLD WITH THE CHILD AND OPENLY HELD THE CHILD
   26  OUT AS THEIR OWN.
   27    (III) AN INDIVIDUAL WHO DONATES SPERM FOR USE TO CONCEIVE A  CHILD  BY
   28  ANOTHER  PERSON,  OTHER  THAN  THE DONOR'S SPOUSE OR DOMESTIC PARTNER AS
   29  DEFINED IN SECTION TWENTY-EIGHT HUNDRED FIVE-Q OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW,
   30  IS NOT A PARENT OF A CHILD THEREBY CONCEIVED UNLESS THE  DONOR  AND  THE
   31  PERSON AGREE IN WRITING THAT THE DONOR SHALL BE A PARENT.  NOTWITHSTAND-
   32  ING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF LAW, GENETIC TEST RESULTS SHALL NOT ESTABLISH
   33  PARENTAGE  OF  A  SPERM DONOR UNLESS THE DONOR IS THE SPOUSE OR DOMESTIC
   34  PARTNER OF THE CHILD'S MOTHER, OR THE DONOR AND THE CHILD'S MOTHER AGREE
   35  IN WRITING THAT THE DONOR SHALL BE A PARENT.
   36    (E) FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION, A PARENT SHALL ALSO INCLUDE A PERSON
   37  WHO DEMONSTRATES BY CLEAR AND CONVINCING EVIDENCE THAT (I) THE PARENT OF
   38  SUCH MINOR CHILD CONSENTED TO THE PERSON'S FORMATION OF  A  PARENT-CHILD
   39  RELATIONSHIP  WITH  THE  CHILD,  SUCH CONSENT TO BE EXPRESSED IN WRITTEN
   40  FORM, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ANY OF  THE  FOLLOWING  EXAMPLES:  A
   41  BIRTH  CERTIFICATE,  A  SIGNED LETTER AGREEMENT, AN EXECUTED CONTRACT, A
   42  BIRTH ANNOUNCEMENT, A  RELIGIOUS  CEREMONY  DOCUMENT,  OR  A  SCHOOL  OR
   43  MEDICAL  RECORD;  (II) THE PERSON RESIDED IN THE SAME HOUSEHOLD WITH THE
   44  CHILD FOR A LENGTH OF TIME SUFFICIENT, GIVEN THE AGE OF  THE  CHILD,  TO
   45  HAVE  ESTABLISHED  WITH  THE  CHILD  A  BONDED,  DEPENDENT  RELATIONSHIP
   46  PARENTAL IN NATURE; (III) THE PERSON PERFORMED  PARENTAL  FUNCTIONS  FOR
   47  THE  CHILD TO A SIGNIFICANT DEGREE; AND (IV) THE PERSON FORMED A PARENT-
   48  CHILD BOND WITH THE CHILD. A PARENT UNDER  THIS  SUBDIVISION  SHALL  NOT
   49  INCLUDE  A  GRANDPARENT OF SUCH MINOR CHILD, A PERSON WHOSE RELATIONSHIP
   50  WITH THE CHILD IS BASED UPON PAYMENT BY THE PARENT, OR A PERSON WHO  HAS
   51  NOT  AT ANY TIME BEEN IN A COMMITTED RELATIONSHIP WITH THE PARENT OF THE
   52  CHILD.
   53    (F) A PARENT UNDER SUBDIVISION (D) OR (E) OF  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE
   54  DEEMED TO BE THE LEGAL PARENT OF SUCH MINOR CHILD FOR ALL PURPOSES.

       A. 700                              3

    1    (G) THIS SECTION IS HEREBY DECLARED TO BE A REMEDIAL STATUTE AND IS TO
    2  BE  CONSTRUED  LIBERALLY TO SECURE THE BENEFICIAL INTERESTS AND PURPOSES
    3  THEREOF IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF THE CHILD.
    4    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect immediately and shall apply to all
    5  proceedings filed pursuant to section 70 of the domestic relations  law,
    6  whether  pending as of the effective date of this act or filed thereaft-
    7  er.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the domestic relations law, in relation to determining parentage of a child for purposes of applying to the supreme court or family court for a writ of habeas corpus
